Product Name: Spirit Medical  MU100 Rehab and Physical therapy Upright Bike
Product Description:
MU-100
Bi-directional resistance pedaling allows for level heart rate and lactic acid response.

Product Literature

Click below for more information about this product.

MU100 – UPRIGHT BIKE

Rehabilitation Upright Bike

FEATURES:

ADJUSTABLE PEDAL CRANKS
Enables a clinician to adjust the bike to accommodate a
patient’s ROM performance capabilities. This includes
independently, single side or bi-lateral adjustments from a
limited range-of-motion as small as 15 degrees through full
range-of-motion.
BI-DIRECTIONAL RESISTANCE
Forward and reverse pedaling for instantaneous
retro-cycling.
MULTIPLE RESISTANCE MODES
Constant resistance, constant power and Isokinetic
resistance
DYNAMIC BRAKING
Minimizes impulse loading
WORK RATE
Range from under 5 watts up to 1,750 watts
DOCUMENTABLE PATIENT POSITIONING
All seat and pedal crank adjustments have numbered
indexing for consistent patient set-up from visit to visit.

MULTIPLE SEAT ADJUSTMENTS
a. Up/down seat position detents
b. Fore/aft patient positioning
c. Hand-tight, positive locking knobs
SOFTWARE ASSISTED PATIENT SET-UP
SYMMETRY MONITORING

Measurement of bi-lateral power (example: Left 41 watts -
Right 34 watts)
SUB-MAX VO2 TESTING
(YMCA protocol)

ADVANTAGES AND CLINICAL APPLICATIONS

Closed Kinetic Chain
Begin exercise earlier, safely, and impact free within the pain free ROM thereby reducing the patient’s “fear factor”
Patient Positioning
Incrementally adjustable up/down, fore/aft seat, and pedal crank for easy patient set-up
Exercise in Both Directions
Active and passive movement in both directions
Bi-Lateral Symmetry
Monitoring assists in improving limb deficiencies and walking gait
Patients with
Patella femoral conditions, total knee replacements, ACL, MCL, and PCL repairs, other ligamentous repairs, arthritic
conditions, tendonitis, and many more conditions will benefit

ELECTRONIC AND SOFTWARE FEATURES

1. Intuitive interface for ease of operation
2. Unique knee angle data input allows entry of desired
ROMs to determine seat and pedal crank settings
minimizing the guess work
3. Set-up mode allows quick entry of patient data,
resistance resolution, settings, and how the information is
displayed
4. Large, easy-to-read displays: Time, RPM, Watts, Calories,
METs, Heart Rate, Power, and much more
5. Multiple Programs include: Quick Start, Manual Mode,
Preset Hill, Plateau, and Interval profiles; Custom Facility
protocol program, VO2 sub-max YMCA protocol,
Isokinetic speed based resistance (from 25 to 100 RPM)
6. Unique Symmetry program that measures and displays
power around the pedal stroke. Biofeedback encourages
patients to maintain power between right and left leg

TECH SPECS:-

Power: 90 to 240 volts AC
Overall dimensions: 42.5”L x 21.5”W x 53.5”H
(108cm x 55cm x 136cm)
Net Weight: 136 lbs (62kg)
Max user weight: 330 lbs (150 kg)

Power train:

a. Heavy duty, 8 groove poly-v belt for smooth, quiet operation
b. Dual spring loaded idlers provide a low start-up resistance and forward/reverse pedaling motion
c. Pedal to brake ratio provides smoother pedaling motion

Braking device:

a. Electro-magnetic resistance allows for very small   increments of work- loads (5 watts per level at 60 rpm, 2 watts per level at 30 rpm).
b. Dual electromagnets provide a controlled isokinetic resistance and our unique Dynamic Braking mode.

Product Description:
The Hand Grips help in increasing finger, hand, and forearm strength. These exercise hand grips use foam resistance to strengthen hand and forearm muscles. Ideal for sports that involve lots of wrist motions, these hand squeezers help you build stable and fingers and wrists

The Hand Grips help in increasing finger, hand, and forearm strength. These exercise hand grips use foam resistance to strengthen hand and forearm muscles. Ideal for sports that involve lots of wrist motions, these hand squeezers help you build stable and fingers and wrists. The foam-covered handles of these hand squeezers provide a comfortable grip and are hence very easy to hold and use. Apart from being a strengthening tool, these foam resistance hand grips are also excellent devices that can be used for stress management. Featuring a stylish hand grip with a contemporary black and chromium finish these exercise hand grips look great on any office desk and as well as in the gym. So next time when under stress or if you feel the need for strong wrists and fingers, look no further than the Hand Grips that strengthen muscles while also bringing down stress and tension.

  • Builds finger, hand and forearm strength
  • Uses foam resistance to target hand and forearm muscle
  • Foam handles provide a comfortable grip
  • Also work as stress management tools

Product Name: Spirit Medical MT200 Rehabilitation and Physical Therapy Treadmill
Product Description:
MT200 - Treadmill Incline / decline deck and forward / backward belt provides the most complete eccentric / concentric, extension / flexion motor control protocol development a treadmill can offer.

 

Product Literature

Click below for more information about this product.

MT200 – TREADMILL
For Orthopedic, Sports Medicine, and Athletic Training Exercise

FEATURES:

TWO INDEPENDENT INCLINE MOTORS PROVIDING TRUE INCLINE AND DECLINE
Front incline range from 0 to 15 % grade
Rear decline range from 0 to - 10 % grade
TRUE ZERO SPEED
(when the belt is not moving the motor is locked for
patient safety)
BI-DIRECTIONAL BELT SPEED
Forward belt speed from 0.1 to 10 mph in
0.1 mph increments
Reverse belt speed from 0.1 to 3.0 mph in 0.1 mph
increments – reverse walking
ADJUSTABLE BELT SPEED ACCELERATION
Adjustment range is 1 second to 1 minute for every 1 mph of belt speed

LOW STEP-UP HEIGHT(removable patient step-up)

ADJUSTABLE FULL LENGTH HANDRAILS FOR SAFETY

(accommodates a wide variety of patient populations)
Height – 24.5 to 34.5 inches
Width – 19.5 to 31 inches
INSTRUMENTED DECK TO PROVIDE BASIC GAIT
ASSESSMENT AND TRAINING
Graphical and numeric measurements of Step count; Steps
per minute (cadence); Stride length; and Left vs. Right
Gait Symmetry
MULTIPLE PROGRAM MODES (VO2; Heart Rate;
Manual; Preset Programs: Hill, Plateau, and Interval; Custom
Facility Program)
MULTIPLE DISPLAY MODES (METs; Symmetry;

Cadence; Stride Length; Steps; Pace; all Standard
Biofeedback displays.)

ADVANTAGES AND CLINICAL APPLICATIONS

Orthopedic, Sports Medicine, and Athletic Training Exercise
Use uphill or downhill walking and jogging to emphasize specific muscle groups or motions. Use retro-walking to promote
the use of reciprocal muscle groups not normally exercised during forward walking alone
Cardiopulmonary Exercise
Monitor heart rate by Telemetry or contact heart rate in handgrips. MET level displayed for easy compliance to patient
exercise prescriptions. Belt speeds as low as 0.1 mph to accommodate even the most deconditioned patient.
Older Adult Exercise
Simulate uphill and downhill walking. Retro-walk to reduce flexion contractures with total knee and total hip replacements.
Retro-walk is also great for promoting dorsiflexion. (Using the dual height Geriatric/Pediatric Handrails)
Pediatric Exercise
Small and precise speed increments and adjustable handrails make this treadmill ideal for use with children too.
Neurological Rehabilitation Exercise
Treadmills have long been used in therapy and conditioning to encourage patient compliance. Now, the small speed increments,
specially configured handrails, and gait monitoring permit the neurologically impaired patient population to safely benefit as well.

ELECTRONIC AND SOFTWARE FEATURES

a. Intuitive interface for ease of operation
b. Large easy to read displays
c. Set-up mode button allows for easy access to quick
patient data entry, program and treadmill function
entries
d. Easy access to all program modes; Quick Start,
Manual, Preset, Hill, Plateau, and Interval profiles;
Custom Facility, V02 sub-max Gerkin protocol
program and Symmetry programs
e. Instrumented deck to allow basic gait assessment and training.

TECH SPECS:

Power: 90 to 240 volts AC (Optional)
Motor: 3HP continuous duty
Self-lubricating Belt/Deck
Overall dimensions: 94”L x 36”W x 56.5”H
(238.8cm x 91.4cm x 143.5cm)
Step-up Height: to step: 4.5” (11.5cm) to deck: 9.5” (49.5cm)
Stride Surface: 60”L x 22” W (152.5cm x 56cm)
Net Weight: 286 lbs. (130 kg)
Max user weight: 330 lbs. (150 kg).

Product Name: Spirit Medical MS300 Rehabilitation and Physio Therapy Recumbent Stepper
Product Description:
MS-300
Semi-recumbent seated stepper utilizes a linked, linear motion enabling users to self-adjust the stroke length to accommodate their range-of-motion capabilities; Provides a low impact, functional movement with minimal stress on lower body joints; and like our other products, utilizes our unique bi-lateral symmetry program profiles.

Product Literature

Click below for more information about this product.

MS300 – STEPPER

For Orthopedic, Sports Medicine, Neurological, and Cardiac Rehabilitation as well as Senior Rehab and Wellness Training

FEATURES

STEP-THROUGH FRAME DESIGN

LINKED UPPER AND LOWER BODY

LINEAR PATTERN

ADJUSTABLE HANDLES

With articulating hand grips

CUSHIONED FOOTPLATES

With foot straps

ADJUSTABLE STEP RANGE

From 1 inch to 12 1/2 inches

RESISTANCE MODE

Isokinetic - Step speeds from 10 to 210 steps/minute

LOW INERTIA
Starting resistance of 5 watts

WORK RATE
Range from under 5 watts up to 750 watts

HEART RATE MONITORING

Both handle held and telemetry

MULTIPLE SEAT ADJUSTMENTS

a. 8 position swivel seat with seat belt for patient
    safety and ease of patient ingress and egress
b. 6 position recline seat back for hip
    angle adjustments
c. Fore/aft patient positioning

SYMMETRY MONITORING

Measurement of bi-lateral power (example: Left 41 watts -
Right 34 watts)

NATURAL MOTION
1:1 Leg to Arm Ratio

ADVANTAGES AND CLINICAL APPLICATIONS

Combined Upper and Lower Body Movements

Provides full body workout, building strength and range-of-motion and utilizing wellness programs to increase longevity

Dependently Linked, Linear Motion Pedals
Enables users to self-adjust the stroke length to accommodate their range-of-motion capabilities

Closed Kinetic Chain

Provides low impact, functional movement with minimal stress on knees, Provides low impact, functional movement with minimal stress on knees-

able semi-recumbent position

Quadrilateral Exercise Pattern
Allows users to distribute the exercise efforts across four limbs.

By reducing the effort from the involved limb and transfer-

 ring a greater effort to the uninvolved limbs, they will maintain an elevated heart rate to achieve exercise potential.

Applications Include:

Orthopedic, Sports Medicine, Neurological, and Cardiac Rehabilitation as well as Senior Rehab and Wellness Training

ELECTRONIC AND
SOFTWARE FEATURES

1. Intuitive interface for ease of operation
2. Large, easy-to-read displays: Time, Speed (steps per
minute),Step Length, Step Count, Watts, Calories, METs,

Product Description:
MR-100
Visual biofeedback displaying power output of each limb separately; provides real-time goals for symmetry and equal performance.

Product Literature

Click below for more information about this product.

MR100 – RECUMBENT BIKE

Features Include Adjustable Pedal Cranks

FEATURES:-

ADJUSTABLE PEDAL CRANKS

Enables a clinician to adjust the bike to accommodate a
patient’s ROM performance capabilities. This includes
independently, single side or bi-lateral adjustments from a
limited range-of-motion as small as 15 degrees through full
range-of-motion.
BI-DIRECTIONAL RESISTANCE
Forward and reverse pedaling for instantaneous
retro-cycling.
MULTIPLE RESISTANCE MODES
Constant resistance, constant power and Isokinetic
resistance
DYNAMIC BRAKING
Minimizes impulse loading
WORK RATE
Range from under 5 watts up to 1,750 watts
DOCUMENTABLE PATIENT POSITIONING
All seat and pedal crank adjustments have numbered
indexing for consistent patient set-up from visit to visit.

MULTIPLE SEAT ADJUSTMENTS
a. 8 position swivel seat for ease of patient ingress
and egress
b. 6 position recline seat back for hip
angle adjustments
c. Fore/aft patient positioning
SOFTWARE ASSISTED PATIENT SET-UP
SYMMETRY MONITORING
Measurement of bi-lateral power (example: Left 41 watts -
Right 34 watts)
SUB-MAX VO2 TESTING
(YMCA protocol)

ADVANTAGES AND CLINICAL APPLICATIONS

Closed Kinetic Chain
Begin exercise earlier, safely, and impact free within the pain free ROM thereby reducing the patient’s “fear factor”
Patient Positioning
Adjustable swivel seat position, seat back, and pedal crank for easy patient set-up, knee and hip angle adjustments
Exercise in Both Directions
Active and passive movement in both directions
Bi-Lateral Symmetry
Monitoring assists in improving limb deficiencies and walking gait
Patients with
Patella femoral conditions, total knee replacements, ACL, MCL, and PCL repairs, other ligamentous repairs, arthritic
conditions, tendonitis, and many more conditions will benefit

ELECTRONIC AND SOFTWARE FEATURES

1. Intuitive interface for ease of operation
2. Unique knee angle data input allows entry of desired
ROMs to determine seat and pedal crank settings
minimizing the guess work
3. Set-up mode allows quick entry of patient data,
resistance resolution, settings, and how the information is
displayed
4. Large, easy-to-read displays: Time, RPM, Watts, Calories,
METs, Heart Rate, Power, and much more
5. Multiple Programs include: Quick Start, Manual Mode,
Preset Hill, Plateau, and Interval profiles; Custom Facility
protocol program, VO2 sub-max YMCA protocol,
Isokinetic speed based resistance (from 25 to 100 RPM)
6. Unique Symmetry program that measures and displays
power around the pedal stroke. Biofeedback encourages
patients to maintain power between right and left leg

TECH SPECS

Power: 90 to 240 volts AC
Overall dimensions: 57”L x 17.6”W x 47.2”H
(144.8cm x 44.8cm x 120cm)
Net Weight: 165 lbs (75 kg)
Max user weight: 330 lbs (150 kg)

Power train:
a. Heavy duty, 8 groove poly-v belt for smooth, quiet operation
b. Dual spring loaded idlers provide a low start-up resistance and forward/reverse pedaling motion
c. Pedal to brake ratio provides smoother pedaling motion
Braking device:
a. Electro-magnetic resistance allows for very small increments of work- loads (5 watts per level at 60 rpm, 2 watts per level at 30 rpm).
b. Dual electromagnets provide a controlled isokinetic resistance and our unique Dynamic Braking mode.
